feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 2:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowfall Expected for the Central Interior and Eastern Alaska Range Thursday night into Friday... A weather front is expected to move over the Interior from the south Thursday night into Friday spreading snow across the area. There is still low confidence with the timing and duration of the snowfall as the front could linger over the area into Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO NOON AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations around 6 inches. South wind gusts to 25 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range, Trims Camp and south. * WHEN...From noon Thursday to noon AKDT Friday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 2:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN EXPECTED THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... A FRONT OVER THE EASTERN GULF OF ALASKA WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH N THROUGH THIS EVENING. A SECOND FRONT WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE WILL MERGE WITH THE FIRST FRONT OVER THE NE GULF COAST LATE TONIGHT THEN SPREAD EASTWARD THURSDAY. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 2:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Thursday into Saturday Morning... Elevated surf is expected to develop along the coast near the Yukon Delta and St Lawrence Island. North to northeasterly winds will increase Thursday morning to 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for north facing coastal areas of St Lawrence Island and the Yukon Delta. Winds
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 04 at 9:31PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall over and upstream from Astor combined with breezy northeast winds have brought the Saint Johns River at Astor into Moderate Flood. River levels are forecast to remain in Moderate Flood between 3.0 and 3.1 feet through the weekend.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT HOUSTON COUNTY THROUGH 230 AM CDT... At 127 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Frankston to near Palestine to 13 miles west of Elkhart to near Buffalo. Movement was east southeast at 30 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 1:28AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN RUSK...NORTHWESTERN NACOGDOCHES AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM CDT... At 128 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Reese to 7 miles west of Maydelle to near Elkhart to 9 miles west of Grapeland. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 1:26AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN SUTTON COUNTY THROUGH 215 AM CDT... At 125 AM CDT, Doppler radar was 14 miles south of Sonora, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
